title.narrative: Rwanda Quality Basic Education for Human Capital Development Project

description.narrative: The PDO is to improve teacher competency and student retention and learning in basic education.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education (MINEDUC), Republic of Rwanda
Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (MINECOFIN), Republic of Rwanda

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall no later than eight (8) weeks after the Effective Date, establish MINEDUC-SPIU with core staff and thereaftermaintain during Project implementation.
The Recipient shall no later than eight (8) weeks after the Effective Date, establish REB-SPIU with core staff and thereaftermaintain during Project implementation.
The Recipient shall no later than two (2) weeks after the Effective Date, fully establish and thereafter maintain during Projectimplementation, a Steering Committee.
The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association for approval, a Construction Operation Manual ("COM').
The Recipient shall within one (1) week after the Effective Date adopt such POM as shall have been approved by the Association.

title.narrative: 1.3.d. Number of TTCs with a completed in-depth institutional review by peer TTC principals, REB and UR-CE
1.4.c. Number of TTCs satisfied with model schools' coaching in their practical training
PDO 2: Gain in average scores of targeted lower secondary teachers on tests of Mathematics and Science
1.3.e. Number of TTCs with satisfactory improvements to infrastructure and facilities
1.4.a. Number of model schools with satisfactory infrastructure and facilities improvements
1.4.b. Number of model lessons developed, recorded by model schools, and made available online and sent to schools without internet access
1.3.b. Share of TTC final year students awarded certificate of advanced competency in English through digital platform
1.3.c. Share of TTC final year students awarded certificate of advanced competency in digital literacy through digital platform
3.1.b. Share of Sector Education Officers using digital reporting tool to collect school information and provide feedback to schools on instructional practice and student learning environment
PDO 1: Share of P1-S3 public and government-aided school teachers awarded certificate of achieving at least intermediate level of competency in English
1.2.b. Share of trained lower secondary teachers using the modernized instructional package in beneficiary schools in target districts
1.1.a. Share of P1-S3 teachers in public and government-aided schools registered in English e-learning courses
3.2.c. Share of grievances received and addressed within the project Grievance Redress Mechanism timeframe
2.1.a. Number of additional classrooms built by the project in existing public and government-aided schools and new schools
2.2.b. Number of classrooms receiving pre-primary teaching and learning kits
2.1.b. Number of latrines built by the project in existing public and government-aided schools and new schools
2.3.a. Number of after-school clubs set up in model schools for boys and girls at secondary level to discuss gender-related issues
2.2.a. Number of edutainment episodes produced locally and broadcasted on national radio or television
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
1.1.c. Share of P1-S3 teachers in public and government-aided schools achieving Intermediate level or above on the online digital literacy assessment
1.1.b. Share of P1-S3 teachers in public and government-aided schools registered in digital literacy e-learning courses
PDO 3: Share of P1 students who reach P6
1.2.a. Number of new or updated high-quality scripted lessons in Maths and Science subjects for P4-S3
2.1.c. Average pupil to classroom ratio in public primary schools that are newly constructed by the project or that benefit from additional classrooms through the project
1.3.a. Establishment of English and digital skills volunteer support program in 16 TTCs
3.1.d. Rwanda participating in an international or regional assessment program (process completed and data analyzed and published)
3.2.a. Simulation models fully developed to project future student indicators, teachers' recruitment and infrastructure needs, and used for education planning, budgeting and policy development
3.2.b. Beneficiary survey conducted, with online component launched and survey results processed in a timely manner
3.1.a. New national teacher recruitment policy finalized, officially endorsed, and implemented (including teacher recruitment tests) in all districts
PDO 4: Share of P3 students in public and government-aided schools achieving grade-level proficiency in English (Percentage)
PDO 5: Share of P3 students in public and government-aided schools achieving grade-level proficiency in numeracy
4.1.b. Number of citizen engagement messages through mobile phones
4.2.d. Number of primary and lower secondary schools providing remedial/catch-up support to avoid repetition
4.1.d. Number of teachers trained on safe reopening of schools
4.2.c. Share of teachers and officials who have returned to school at re-opening
4.1.a. Share of primary and lower secondary students who can access remote courses on radio
4.2.a. Number of targeted students at pre-primary and primary level receiving school meal at least 3 times per week for 12 weeks after school reopening
4.1.c. Share of children who can access programs and sensitization campaigns aimed at minimizing the negative impact of school closure such as gender-based violence and school dropout
4.2.b. Share of students who have returned to school at re-opening
PDO 4 (female): Share of P3 students in public and government-aided schools achieving grade-level proficiency in English - Female
PDO 1 (female): Share of P1-S3 public and government-aided school teachers awarded certificate of achieving at least intermediate level of competency in English - Female
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning - Female

Teachers recruited or trained - Female (RMS requirement)

PDO 3 (female): Share of P1 students who reach P6 - Female
